holidays.name: Johnny Appleseed Day
holidays.description: This day celebrates the legendary American pioneer nurseryman Johnny Appleseed, known for planting apple trees across the United States.
holidays.origin: Inspired by John Chapman, an early 19th-century folk hero who became famous for his generous spirit and apple orchards.
holidays.funFact: Johnny Appleseed didn‚Äôt just plant apple trees for fun ‚Äî apples were used to make hard cider, which was often safer to drink than water back then!

holidays.name: National Dumpling Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day to savor the delicious, doughy, and often meat- or veggie-filled delights known as dumplings, celebrated especially in American food culture.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created by food enthusiasts to appreciate diverse culinary traditions involving dumplings.
holidays.funFact: Dumplings come in so many forms worldwide ‚Äî from Japanese gyoza to Polish pierogi ‚Äî and each has its own unique twist!

holidays.name: European Day of Languages
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting language learning and cultural diversity across Europe and beyond.
holidays.origin: Established by the Council of Europe in 2001 to encourage lifelong language education and celebrate Europe‚Äôs rich linguistic heritage.
holidays.funFact: Europe has around 225 indigenous languages, making it one of the most linguistically diverse regions on Earth!

holidays.name: Love Note Day
holidays.description: A sweet, often secret holiday encouraging people to write love notes or heartfelt messages to someone special, spreading affection in simple, old-fashioned ways.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day that caught traction with romantics and stationary lovers who enjoy handwritten notes.
holidays.funFact: Before phones and texts, love notes were the original emojis ‚Äî and way more romantic!
